vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
γραμμᾰτ-εύς, έως, ὁ,
secretary, registrar, title of officials at Athens and elsewhere, [NT+5th c.BC+]; γ. τοῦ θεοῦ [Refs 5th c.BC+]; also of subordinate officials, clerk, sometimes a term of contempt, ὄλεθρος γ. [Refs 4th c.BC+]; ἡ γ., in joke, [Refs 5th c.BC+]
__2 metaphorically, recorder, of memory, [Refs 5th c.BC+]
__3 scholar, γ. σαφής [Refs 4th c.BC+]
__4 one who traces or marks out, of Egyptian embalmers, [Refs 1st c.BC+]
vocabInfos.shortDef: teacher or expert in the law, scholar, scribe, city clerk
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
teacher or expert in the law, scholar, scribe, city clerk
a scribe; a clerk, town-clerk, registrar, recorder, Acts 19:35; one skilled in the Jewish law, a teacher or interpreter of the law, Mt. 2:4; 5:20, and frequently ; generically a religious teacher, Mt. 13:52; by synecdoche any one distinguished for learning or wisdom, 1Cor. 1:20
vocabInfos._es_Definition: escriba, experto en las leyes judías (possiblemente en referencia a los cristianos MAT.13:52; 23:34) ; escribano de la ciudad (HCH.19:35) ; hombre de letras, erudito (1CO.1:20)
